pageContext.claim: “1. Which country has the largest carbon emission reduction? AMERICA!”
pageContext.analysis: The United States has had the largest drop in total emissions since 2005, but as the Post’s climate team noted, that is not the most relevant statistic because the large absolute emissions declines only are possible in highly populated countries that pollute a large amount per capita. The percent change in total emissions is more important and several countries out pace the U.S.
